verses.kjv: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?
verses.ct: So what benefit does a Jewish person have? What value is there in circumcision?

verses.kjv: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
verses.ct: A great deal, in every way! First and foremost, the Jewish people were entrusted with the very words of God.

verses.kjv: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
verses.ct: But what if some of them were unfaithful? Does their lack of faith cancel out God's faithfulness?

verses.kjv: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.
verses.ct: Absolutely not! God remains true even if every person is a liar. As Scripture says, 'So that you are proven right when you speak, and you prevail when you are judged.'

verses.kjv: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)
verses.ct: But if our unrighteousness highlights God's righteousness, what do we say then? That God is unjust for bringing his wrath? (I'm using a human way of thinking here.)

verses.kjv: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
verses.ct: Absolutely not! If that were the case, how could God judge the world?

verses.kjv: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
verses.ct: But someone might argue, 'If my dishonesty causes God's truth to stand out even more and brings him glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?'

verses.kjv: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.
verses.ct: Why not go further and say, 'Let's do evil so that good will result'? Some people slander us by claiming that's what we teach. Their condemnation is well deserved.

verses.kjv: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;
verses.ct: So where does that leave us? Are we Jewish people any better off? Not at all! We've already demonstrated that both Jews and non-Jews alike are all trapped under sin.

verses.kjv: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
verses.ct: As Scripture says: 'No one is righteous — not even one person.

verses.kjv: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.
verses.ct: No one truly understands; no one searches for God.

verses.kjv: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
verses.ct: Everyone has turned away; together they have become worthless. No one does what is good — not even one person.'

verses.kjv: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips:
verses.ct: 'Their throats are like open tombs; their tongues practice deception. The venom of snakes hides behind their lips.'

verses.kjv: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
verses.ct: 'Their mouths overflow with curses and bitterness.'

verses.kjv: Their feet are swift to shed blood:
verses.ct: 'They rush eagerly to take someone's life.'

verses.kjv: Destruction and misery are in their ways:
verses.ct: 'Ruin and suffering follow wherever they go.'

verses.kjv: And the way of peace have they not known:
verses.ct: 'They have never discovered the path to peace.'

verses.kjv: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
verses.ct: 'They have no reverence for God whatsoever.'

verses.kjv: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
verses.ct: Now we know that everything the law says is directed at those who live under the law, so that every excuse is silenced and the entire world stands accountable to God.

verses.kjv: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
verses.ct: For this reason, no human being will be declared righteous in God's sight by following the law's requirements, because the law's purpose is to make us aware of sin.

verses.kjv: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
verses.ct: But now God's righteousness has been revealed apart from the law, though the law and the prophets both pointed to it.

verses.kjv: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
verses.ct: This righteousness from God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to everyone who believes. There is no distinction,

verses.kjv: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
verses.ct: because everyone has sinned and fallen short of the glory of God.

verses.kjv: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
verses.ct: Yet they are declared righteous as a free gift by his grace, through the redemption that is found in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;
verses.ct: God presented Christ as the atoning sacrifice, received through faith in his blood. He did this to demonstrate his righteousness, because in his patience he had passed over sins committed earlier.

verses.kjv: To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
verses.ct: He did this to demonstrate his righteousness at the present time, proving that he is both just himself and the one who declares righteous anyone who puts their faith in Jesus.

verses.kjv: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.
verses.ct: So where does that leave room for boasting? It's completely eliminated. On what basis? On the basis of following rules? No — on the basis of faith.

verses.kjv: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
verses.ct: For we maintain that a person is declared righteous through faith, apart from following the requirements of the law.

verses.kjv: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:
verses.ct: Is God only the God of the Jewish people? Isn't he also the God of non-Jews? Yes, he is their God too.

verses.kjv: Seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.
verses.ct: Since there is only one God, he will declare the circumcised righteous through faith, and the uncircumcised righteous through that same faith.

verses.kjv: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
verses.ct: So are we abolishing the law by emphasizing faith? Absolutely not! Instead, we are upholding the law.
